intro: Meibomia gangetica, commonly known as the Indian meibomia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Asia, including India, Sri Lanka, and parts of Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round fruits. Meibomia gangetica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
